org.aion.api

Interface ITx


  • public interface ITx
    ITx is an interface of the class Transaction. ITx assists in providing methods for transaction related calls.
    Author:
    Jay Tseng

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ApiMsg call(TxArgs args)
      Initiates a call to retrieve the result from a contract.
      ApiMsg compile(java.lang.String code)
      Sends the source code to be compiled in the backend, and returns all relevant information about the compiled code.
      ApiMsg contractDeploy(ContractDeploy cd)
      Deploys a new contract onto the Aion blockchain.
      ApiMsg estimateNrg(TxArgs args)
      Estimates the gas required to execute transaction.
      ApiMsg eventDeregister(java.util.List<java.lang.String> evt, org.aion.base.type.Address address)
      remove the listening events by given the event name and the contract address.
      ApiMsg eventRegister(java.util.List<java.lang.String> evt, ContractEventFilter ef, org.aion.base.type.Address address)
      register the events the user want to listen by given the event name, event filter and the contract address.
      void fastTxbuild(TxArgs args)
      Pre-build TxArgs for increasing sendTransaction speeds if these transaction must been executed repeatedly.

    • Method Detail

      • contractDeploy

        ApiMsg contractDeploy(ContractDeploy cd)
        Deploys a new contract onto the Aion blockchain. Note that contract response via successful execution does not indicate that the contract has been deployed if you use async mode.
        Parameters:
        cd - the class ContractDeploy represent the contract deploy arguments. Use the class builder ContractDeployBuilder to create the class object.
        Returns:
        the class DeployResponse information wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.

      • call

        ApiMsg call(TxArgs args)
        Initiates a call to retrieve the result from a contract.
        Parameters:
        args - given a class TxArgs created by the builder class TxArgsBuilder.
        Returns:
        the bytes array represent the function defined by the contract wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.

      • estimateNrg

        ApiMsg estimateNrg(TxArgs args)
        Estimates the gas required to execute transaction.
        Parameters:
        args - given a class TxArgs created by the builder class TxArgsBuilder.
        Returns:
        amount of energy by long value required to execute the transaction.

      • getTxReceipt

        ApiMsg getTxReceipt(org.aion.base.type.Hash256 transactionHash)
        Retrieves the transaction receipt given a transaction hash in the format of TxReceipt.
        Parameters:
        transactionHash - the 32 bytes hash represent by the class Hash256.
        Returns:
        the class TxReceipt wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.

      • sendTransaction

        ApiMsg sendTransaction(TxArgs args)
        Initiates a transaction given a class of type TxArgs. This function provides no functionality to assist with encoding or decoding transaction data. Users may choose to either use the more convenient Contract class for contract transactions.
        Parameters:
        args - given a class TxArgs created by the builder class TxArgsBuilder.
        Returns:
        the class MessageResponse returned from backend and the current progress in the backend wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.
        See Also:
        Contract, MsgRsp

      • sendSignedTransaction

        ApiMsg sendSignedTransaction(TxArgs args,
                             org.aion.base.util.ByteArrayWrapper key,
                             java.lang.String passphrase)
        Initiates a transaction given the class TxArgs, the class ByteArrayWrapper represent the private key of the transaction sender and the class String reresent the passphrase of the key. Then send a transaction signed with the sender's key.This function provides no functionality to assist with encoding or decoding transaction data. Users may choose to either use the more convenient Contract class for contract transactions.
        Parameters:
        args - given a class TxArgs created by the builder class TxArgsBuilder.
        key - the class ByteArrayWrapper represent the sender's private key.
        passphrase - the class String represent the sender's passphrase.
        Returns:
        the class MessageResponse returned from backend and the current progress in the backend wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.
        See Also:
        Contract, MsgRsp

      • sendRawTransaction

        ApiMsg sendRawTransaction(org.aion.base.util.ByteArrayWrapper tx)
        Initiates a transaction given the class ByteArrayWrapper represent the encoded transaction byte array with the sender's signature. This function provides no functionality to assist with encoding or decoding transaction data. Users may choose to either use the more convenient Contract class for contract transactions.
        Parameters:
        tx - given a class ByteArrayWrapper represent the encoded transaction byte array with the sender's signature.
        Returns:
        the class MsgRsp returned from backend and the current progress in the backend wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.
        See Also:
        Contract, MsgRsp

      • compile

        ApiMsg compile(java.lang.String code)
        Sends the source code to be compiled in the backend, and returns all relevant information about the compiled code. Will throw if backend compiler is unavailable or code is improperly formatted.
        Parameters:
        code - the class String of the source code to be compiled.
        Returns:
        the interface Map of the class CompileResponse containing the contract name as key and as value wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through the method getObject.

      • getSolcVersion

        ApiMsg getSolcVersion()
        Get the kernel contained solidity compiler version.
        Returns:
        the class String wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through the method getObject.

      • getCode

        ApiMsg getCode(org.aion.base.type.Address address,
               long blockNumber)
        Retrieves the compiled code for a given contract.
        Parameters:
        address - the class Address represent the deployed contract address.
        blockNumber - block number of which the contract by long value was commited on. Indicate -1L to check for the latest block.
        Returns:
        the variable bytes array of the compiled code wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.

      • fastTxbuild

        void fastTxbuild(TxArgs args)
        Pre-build TxArgs for increasing sendTransaction speeds if these transaction must been executed repeatedly. This function provides no functionality to assist with encoding or decoding transaction data. Users may choose to either use the more convenient Contract class for contract transactions.
        Parameters:
        args - the class TxArgs represent the Transaction arguments.

      • fastTxbuild

        void fastTxbuild(TxArgs args,
                 boolean call)
        Pre-build TxArgs for increasing sendTransaction speeds if these transaction must been executed repeatedly. This function provides no functionality to assist with encoding or decoding transaction data. Users may choose to either use the more convenient Contract object for contract transactions.
        Parameters:
        args - the class TxArgs represent the Transaction arguments.
        call - the boolean value represent the function of the contract is a call function.

      • nonBlock

        ITx nonBlock()
        Mark the transaction send to kernel and return immediately. The developer prefer to check the transaction status later.
        Returns:
        ITx.

      • timeout

        ITx timeout(int t)
        Mark the transaction timeout. If the message of this transaction can not been done within timeout, the transaction status will been dropped in the transaction pending pool. The default timeout is 300 seconds. If user set timeout below than 30 seconds, the timeout will been modified to 30 seconds.
        Parameters:
        t - timeout represent by millisecond.
        Returns:
        Transaction object.

      • getMsgStatus

        ApiMsg getMsgStatus(org.aion.base.util.ByteArrayWrapper msgHash)
        Check the transaction progress given by the api session hash value.
        Parameters:
        msgHash - the 8 bytes array wrapped by the class ByteArrayWrapper represent the session hash the api client sent.
        Returns:
        the class MessageResponse including transaction status and hash wrapped into ApiMsg. You can retrieve through the method getObject.

      • eventDeregister

        ApiMsg eventDeregister(java.util.List<java.lang.String> evt,
                       org.aion.base.type.Address address)
        remove the listening events by given the event name and the contract address.
        Parameters:
        evt - the interface List of the class String represent the events the user want to listen.
        address - the class Address represent the deployed contract address.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the register success or failed.

      • eventRegister

        ApiMsg eventRegister(java.util.List<java.lang.String> evt,
                     ContractEventFilter ef,
                     org.aion.base.type.Address address)
        register the events the user want to listen by given the event name, event filter and the contract address.
        Parameters:
        evt - the interface List of the class String represent the events the user want to listen.
        ef - the class ContractEventFilter represent the event query conditions.
        address - the class Address represent the deployed contract address.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the register success or failed.
